abstract: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, known as FARC, is attempting to prepare its fighters for life after five decades of rebellion; Colombian peace negotiations, in final and most critical stage, are hoping to end guerrilla war that has killed more than 220,000 people, left 40,000 missing and made refugees of some 5.7 million others.

headline.print_headline: Inside a Rebel Camp in Colombia, Marx and Free Love Reign
headline.main: In a Rebel Camp in Colombia, Marx and Free Love Reign

snippet: For the guerrillas of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, many of whom have never set foot in their country’s cities, the prospect of peace after 50 years means an uncertain future.
lead_paragraph: For the guerrillas of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, many of whom have never set foot in their country’s cities, the prospect of peace after 50 years means an uncertain future.
